page.title: 06Abergavenny's Geography
page.content: The mountains around the town are,Sugar Loaf(596m),Blorenge(559m),Skirrid Fawr (486m),Little Skirrid(270m),Deri(343m). The Usk flows between Sugar Loaf and Blorenge.The valley was altered by a glacier which made it wider and left a flat floor.Local rocks are sedimentary often sandstone.The summit of Sugar Loaf is shaped like a vocanic cone but there were never volcanos here.The Gavenny is a little stream in a big valley which was cut by the River Honddu thousands of years ago.The Honddu used to flow to the Usk,but during glaciation a terminal moraine was deposited at Llanfihangel Crucorney blocking the valley.The Honddu was diverted and now the Gavenny flows as a misfit stream in the valley.Abergavenny grew up at the confluence of the Gavenny and the Usk.
